required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Look at the Efficacy and Safety of Keppra® Extended Release Formulation - XR
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Randomized Efficacy and Safety Study of Keppra® Extended Release Formulation - XR Once Daily as add-on Therapy in Subjects From 12 to 70 Years With Refractory Epilepsy Suffering From Partial Onset Seizures.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a safety and efficacy study of Keppra® extended release formulation - XR in patients with epilepsy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Partial Onset Seizure (POS) Frequency Per Week - Intention-To-Treat (ITT) Population
primary_outcome.description: Number of POS over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period.

primary_outcome.measure: Partial Onset Seizure (POS) Frequency Per Week - Per Protocol (PP) Population
primary_outcome.description: Number of POS over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period

secondary_outcome.measure: POS Seizure Frequency Per Week Over Baseline and Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline Period (8 weeks) - Treatment Period (12 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: All (Type I+II+III) Seizures Frequency Per Week
secondary_outcome.description: Number of All type Seizures over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period (Type I -Partial Onset Seizures, Type II - Generalized Seizures, Type III - Unclassified Epileptic Seizures)
A subject is considered as a 50% responder in POS if he/she has a >= 50% decrease from Baseline in the POS frequency/week over Treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Response in Weekly POS Frequency (Categorized Into 6 Categories According to Reduction) Over the Treatment Period of 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The response is classified according to the percent reduction from baseline in the POS frequency per week over the Treatment Period of 12 weeks duration.

intervention.description: 500mg extended release oral tablet, 2 tablets once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a confirmed diagnosis of refractory epilepsy Patients must be receiving 1 - 3 concomitant Anti-Epileptic Drugs (AED).
- Female patients without childbearing potential. Female patients with childbearing potential are eligible if they use a medically accepted non-hormonal contraceptive method.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Seizures occurring in clusters
- Status epilepticus within 3 months of Visit 1.
- History of non-epileptic seizures.
- Known allergic reaction or intolerance to pyrrolidine derivatives and/or excipients.
- Pregnant or lactating women. Any woman with childbearing potential who is not using a medically accepted, non-hormonal method of birth control.

results_reference.citation: Peltola J, Coetzee C, Jiménez F, Litovchenko T, Ramaratnam S, Zaslavaskiy L, Lu ZS, Sykes DM; Levetiracetam XR N01235 Study Group. Once-daily extended-release levetiracetam as adjunctive treatment of partial-onset seizures in patients with epilepsy: a double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled trial. Epilepsia. 2009 Mar;50(3):406-14. doi: 10.1111/j.1528-1167.2008.01817.x.

Richy FF, Banerjee S, Brabant Y, Helmers S. Levetiracetam extended release and levetiracetam immediate release as adjunctive treatment for partial-onset seizures: an indirect comparison of treatment-emergent adverse events using meta-analytic techniques. Epilepsy Behav. 2009 Oct;16(2):240-5. doi: 10.1016/j.yebeh.2009.07.013. Epub 2009 Aug 20.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The N01235 study began recruitment in August 2006 with study completion occurring in May 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Baseline and Participant Flow data consists of the Intent-to-Treat (ITT) analysis group. The ITT group consists of all randomized subjects.

outcome.title: Partial Onset Seizure (POS) Frequency Per Week - Intention-To-Treat (ITT) Population
outcome.description: Number of POS over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period.
outcome.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) (Analyses were performed on subjects from the ITT with non-missing information during baseline and treatment period.)

measure.title: Partial Onset Seizure (POS) Frequency Per Week - Intention-To-Treat (ITT) Population
measure.description: Number of POS over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period.
measure.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) (Analyses were performed on subjects from the ITT with non-missing information during baseline and treatment period.)

analysis.method_desc: Analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) on (log-) POS freq/week over Treatment period with Treatment, (log-) Baseline POS freq/week as covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment difference was assessed through the percent reduction in POS freq/week of Keppra over Placebo by back transformation of the results of the ANCOVA on log data

outcome.title: POS Seizure Frequency Per Week Over Baseline and Treatment Period
outcome.time_frame: Baseline Period (8 weeks) - Treatment Period (12 weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Population - no imputation techniques used for missing data (number of subjects with non-missing data for Baseline = ITT Population and for Treatment period = 75 patients for Levetiractam and 78 patients for PBO) Clusters of type I count are included in the count of Type I seizures

measure.title: POS Seizure Frequency Per Week Over Baseline and Treatment Period
measure.population: ITT Population - no imputation techniques used for missing data (number of subjects with non-missing data for Baseline = ITT Population and for Treatment period = 75 patients for Levetiractam and 78 patients for PBO) Clusters of type I count are included in the count of Type I seizures

outcome.title: All (Type I+II+III) Seizures Frequency Per Week
outcome.description: Number of All type Seizures over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period (Type I -Partial Onset Seizures, Type II - Generalized Seizures, Type III - Unclassified Epileptic Seizures)
outcome.population: ITT (Analyses were performed on subjects from the ITT with non-missing information during baseline and treatment period.)

measure.title: All (Type I+II+III) Seizures Frequency Per Week
measure.description: Number of All type Seizures over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period (Type I -Partial Onset Seizures, Type II - Generalized Seizures, Type III - Unclassified Epileptic Seizures)
measure.population: ITT (Analyses were performed on subjects from the ITT with non-missing information during baseline and treatment period.)

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA on (log-) seizure frequency per week over Treatment period with Treatment, (log-) Baseline seizure frequency per week as covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment difference was assessed through the percent reduction in POS frequency per week of Keppra over Placebo by back transformation of the results of the ANCOVA on log data

outcome.title: 50% Response in Weekly POS Frequency
outcome.description: A subject is considered as a 50% responder in POS if he/she has a >= 50% decrease from Baseline in the POS frequency/week over Treatment period.
outcome.population: ITT Based on the number of evaluable patients. A patient is considered as evaluable for the response status if he has seizure information in at least one of the periods (baseline or treatment period)

measure.title: 50% Response in Weekly POS Frequency
measure.description: A subject is considered as a 50% responder in POS if he/she has a >= 50% decrease from Baseline in the POS frequency/week over Treatment period.
measure.population: ITT Based on the number of evaluable patients. A patient is considered as evaluable for the response status if he has seizure information in at least one of the periods (baseline or treatment period)

analysis.method_desc: Logistic regression analysis including Treatment as a factor.
analysis.estimate_desc: Based on the number of evaluable patients. A patient is considered as evaluable for the response status if he has seizure information in at least one of the period (baseline or treatment period.

outcome.title: Response in Weekly POS Frequency (Categorized Into 6 Categories According to Reduction) Over the Treatment Period of 12 Weeks
outcome.description: The response is classified according to the percent reduction from baseline in the POS frequency per week over the Treatment Period of 12 weeks duration.
outcome.population: ITT Based on the number of evaluable patients. A patient is considered as evaluable for the response status if he has seizure information in at least one of the periods (baseline or treatment period).

measure.title: Response in Weekly POS Frequency (Categorized Into 6 Categories According to Reduction) Over the Treatment Period of 12 Weeks
measure.description: The response is classified according to the percent reduction from baseline in the POS frequency per week over the Treatment Period of 12 weeks duration.
measure.population: ITT Based on the number of evaluable patients. A patient is considered as evaluable for the response status if he has seizure information in at least one of the periods (baseline or treatment period).

analysis.method_desc: Subjects with missing data during the Treatment period were considered in the category <-25%.

outcome.title: Partial Onset Seizure (POS) Frequency Per Week - Per Protocol (PP) Population
outcome.description: Number of POS over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period
outcome.population: Per Protocol (PP) Population (Analyses were performed on subjects from the PP Population with non-missing information during both baseline and treatment period)

measure.title: Partial Onset Seizure (POS) Frequency Per Week - Per Protocol (PP) Population
measure.description: Number of POS over the treatment period standardized to 1 week period
measure.population: Per Protocol (PP) Population (Analyses were performed on subjects from the PP Population with non-missing information during both baseline and treatment period)

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA on (log-) Treatment POS frequency per week with Treatment and (log-) Baseline POS frequency per week as covariate

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment difference was assessed through the percent reduction in POS frequency per week of Keppra over Placebo by back transformation of the results of the ANCOVA on log data

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected from Selection Visit (Week 0) until Final Visit (Week 22).
reported_events.desc: Adverse Event reporting is data is taken from the Safety Set (SS) analysis group. The SS is comprised all subjects who were dispensed study medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: UCB has > 60 days but <= 180 days to review results communications prior to public release and may delete information that compromises ongoing studies or is considered proprietary. This restriction is not intended to compromise the objective scientific integrity of the manuscript, it being understood that results shall be published regardless of outcome.
